name: QuestDB
headline: The fastest open source time series database
description:
QuestDB is a high-performance, open-source database for time series data. It focuses on fast ingest, blazingly fast queries and superior developer experience with SQL and open formats.

QuestDB is designed from the ground up to operate as close to the hardware as possible -- eliminating ingestion bottlenecks and lowering overall hardware requirements.

QuestDB powers the infrastructure for companies in Financial Services, Crypto/Web3, Space Exploration, and Energy/Renewables.

founders.name: Vlad Ilyushchenko, Founder
founders.description:
Founder, CTO, QuestDB

1997 - 2019 Software Engineer, Electronic Trading

founders.name: Tancrede Collard
founders.description: Co-founder and head of product at QuestDB. Before that, I was running algorithmic trading desks at banks and cryptocurrency firms.

# Peak time-series performance
QuestDB is the world's fastest growing open-source time-series database. It offers massive ingestion throughput, millisecond queries, powerful time-series SQL extensions, and scales well with minimal and maximal hardware. Save costs with better performance and efficiency.
[View Live Demo](https://questdb.io/<https:/demo.questdb.io/>)[See Enterprise →](https://questdb.io/</enterprise/>)
[![Aquis Exchange logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/aquis.svg)](https://questdb.io/</case-study/aquis/>)
![Mizuho logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/mizuho.svg)
![OKX logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/okx.svg)
![Hidden Road logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/hiddenroad.svg)
![B3 logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/b3.svg)
![Airbus logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/airbus.svg)
[![Airtel logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/airtel.svg)](https://questdb.io/</case-study/airtel-xstream-play/>)
![Linux Foundation logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/linux-foundation.svg)
## High performance
  * Low-latency
  * SIMD-optimized queries
  * Ingest 4M rows/s per node

[See benchmarks](https://questdb.io/</blog/?tag=benchmark>)
## For developers
  * Open source
  * Fastest growing TSDB
  * SQL & PGwire compatible

[See live demo](https://questdb.io/<https:/demo.questdb.io>)
## Open formats
  * Historical data in Parquet
  * Multiple availability zones
  * Decouple storage/compute

[See Enterprise](https://questdb.io/</enterprise/>)
## Explore our live QuestDB demo and data
Query over 1.2 billion rows in milliseconds
Try QuestDB demo in your browser
[Launch demo and see result >](https://questdb.io/<https:/demo.questdb.io?query=--%20Find%20the%20latest%20value%20available%20for%20each%20symbol%20\(crypto%20pair\).%20This%20dataset%20collects%20live%20market%20data%20from%20the%20OKX%20API.%0ASELECT%20*%0AFROM%20trades%0AWHERE%20symbol%20IN%20\('BTC-USDT'%2C%20'ETH-USDT'\)%0ALATEST%20ON%20timestamp%20PARTITION%20BY%20symbol%3B&executeQuery=true>)
## QuestDB leaps your team forward
Leadership through open formats
Globally distributed, hyper-fast next generation database
![Sassy QDB dashboard](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/images/enterprise/questdb-type3.svg)
Open formats
    Leverages existing open formats. No vendor lock-in.
Apache Parquet
    Enhanced compression and encoding, for ingress or egress.
Super read/write
    Fast ingest and low latency SQL queries
Full stream
    Stream market data in from feeds or sensors, apply Parquet on read
Direct to Parquet?
    Bypass QuestDB ingest, query [Parquet](https://questdb.io/</glossary/apache-parquet/>) directly from the object store
Versatile ecosystem
    Diverse clients connect to your data, app, AI and ML frameworks
## Use QuestDB with the tools you love
[![Redpanda logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/redpanda.svg)Redpanda](https://questdb.io/</docs/third-party-tools/redpanda/>)[![Postgres logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/pg.svg)Postgres](https://questdb.io/</docs/reference/api/postgres/>)[![Grafana logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/grafana.svg)Grafana](https://questdb.io/</docs/third-party-tools/grafana/>)[![Kafka logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/kafka.svg)Kafka](https://questdb.io/</docs/third-party-tools/kafka/>)[![Python logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/python.svg)Python](https://questdb.io/<https:/github.com/questdb/py-questdb-client>)[![Pandas logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/pandas.svg)Pandas](https://questdb.io/</docs/third-party-tools/pandas/>)[![Superset logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/apache-superset.svg)Superset](https://questdb.io/</docs/third-party-tools/superset/>)[![Spark logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/apache-spark.svg)Spark](https://questdb.io/</docs/third-party-tools/spark/>)[![Telegraf logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/influxdata.svg)Telegraf](https://questdb.io/</docs/third-party-tools/telegraf/>)[![MindsDB logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/mindsdb.svg)MindsDB](https://questdb.io/</docs/third-party-tools/mindsdb/>)[![Cube logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/cube.svg)Cube](https://questdb.io/</blog/2022/04/26/time-series-data-analytics-with-questdb-and-cube/>)[![Databento logo](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/databento.svg)Databento](https://questdb.io/</docs/third-party-tools/databento/>)
## Simple, high performance SQL
Easily adopted, time-series optimized SQL
Arrow up icon
```

SELECTtimestamp,symbol, price
FROM trades
WHEREtimestampIN'2024-06-21;1M';

```

```

-- Search time
SELECTtimestamp,symbol, price
FROM trades
WHEREtimestampIN'2024-06-21;1M';

```

```

SELECTtimestamp,symbol,avg(price)
FROM trades
SAMPLEBY5mFILL(LINEAR);

```

```

-- Slice time
SELECTtimestamp,symbol,avg(price)
FROM trades
SAMPLEBY5mFILL(LINEAR);

```

```

SELECTtimestamp,symbol, price
FROM trades
LATESTONtimestampPARTITIONBYsymbol;

```

```

-- Navigate time
SELECTtimestamp,symbol, price
FROM trades
LATESTONtimestampPARTITIONBYsymbol;

```

```

SELECTtimestamp, bid_price, ask_price
FROM bids
ASOFJOIN asks;

```

```

-- Merge time
SELECTtimestamp, bid_price, ask_price
FROM bids
ASOFJOIN asks;

```

Arrow up icon
### ![Magnifying glass icon](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/images/searchTime.svg)Search Time
Filter and search for specific timestamps with "WHERE"
### ![Knife icon](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/images/sliceTime.svg)Slice Time
Create time buckets and aggregate by intervals with "SAMPLE BY"
### ![Indication arrow icon](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/images/navigateTime.svg)Navigate Time
Search time series from most recent values to oldest with "LATEST ON"
### ![Merge Time icon](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/images/mergeTime.svg)Merge Time
Join two tables based on timestamp where timestamps do not exactly match with "ASOF JOIN"
Capital Markets
## 24/7 trading of power and gas
Leading energy trading firm Energetech leverages QuestDB for real-time trading signals. Processes massive amounts of market and fundamental data to generate forecasts to drive trading decisions.
  * **High throughput:** Handles bursts of data while ingesting 140GB of data per day
  * **Real-time aggregations:** Process live market data with millisecond response time
  * **Simplification:** Built-in deduplication and out of order handling simplifies the data pipeline


[Learn more about our customers →](https://questdb.io/</customers/>)
![Energetech logo](https://questdb.io/logos/energetech.svg)
> "QuestDB is a specialized database that excels in its focus area. It's easy to get started and addresses many pain points with time series data, offering outstanding read and write performance."
Aleksander Temmo · Energetech
Senior Quantitative Power Trading Analyst
## Peak performance time-series
Hyper ingestion
For massive volumes of time-series data, trust a specialized time-series database. Timestamps are first-class, and blistering throughput is sustained even through the highest data cardinality. Deduplication and out-of-order ingestion also work right out-of-the-box.
[Read the docs](https://questdb.io/</docs/>)
> Using QuestDB, we deliver time series datasets with real-time market data from a top 10 blockchain. This outperforms a legacy cloud-based data platform at a fraction of the cost, reducing TCO by >90%.
![](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/xrp.svg)
Daniel Siedentopf — Senior Software Developer, XRP Ledger Foundation
![QuestDB performance compared to TimescaleDB and InfluxDB. QuestDB is the clear winner.](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/images/benchmark/benchmark_all_q1_2024.webp&w=3840)
## Community love for QuestDB
Category user reviews on G2 rate QuestDB with the highest user satisfaction. Visit our vibrant Slack to chat with the community, the QuestDB core developers, and our technical AI-bot, to find out why.
[Join Slack](https://questdb.io/<https:/slack.questdb.com/>)[Read G2 reviews →](https://questdb.io/<https:/www.g2.com/products/questdb/reviews>)
## Better on a Pi, best on full hardware
Max performance, min hardware
Compute costs keep rising. Keep them low with an efficient solution. QuestDB runs well on low hardware, within high cardinality data and with deduplication and out-of-order indexing. On just a 4GB Raspberry Pi, QuestDB outperforms competitors on robust hardware. Have robust hardware? QuestDB scales up to many millions of rows per second.
[Read the docs](https://questdb.io/</docs/>)
> QuestDB is the first database that scales to the volume and cardinality of data that Beeks Analytics is capable of generating.
![](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/logos/beeks.svg)
Steve Rodgers — CTO, Beeks Group
![QuestDB performance compared to TimescaleDB and InfluxDB. QuestDB is the clear winner.](https://questdb.io/.netlify/images?url=/images/min-hardware-comp-graph.webp&w=3840)
![Aquis Exchange logo](https://questdb.io/logos/aquis.svg)
QuestDB is a time series database truly built by developers for developers. We found that QuestDB provides a unicorn solution to handle extreme TPS while also offering a simplified SQL programming interface.
>Paul RobertsCTO, Aquis Exchange
## The next generation has arrived
Upgrade to QuestDB
Hyper ingestion, millisecond queries, and powerful SQL.Lower bills through peak efficiency.
[Download](https://questdb.io/</download/>)

QuestDB is the fastest open source time series database

generated_description:
**QuestDB Overview**

Founded in 2019, QuestDB is an ambitious startup based in London, UK, and a proud member of Y Combinator's Batch S20. Its mission? To be the fastest open-source time series database around. With a compact team of 30, QuestDB is creating waves in various sectors, including financial services, cryptocurrency, space exploration, and renewable energy. 

The heart of QuestDB's innovation lies in its unmatched performance. Designed with a low-level architecture that taps directly into hardware capabilities, it addresses the common bottlenecks that plague traditional databases, resulting in powerful ingestion and querying speeds. Users can expect performance metrics like ingesting 4 million rows per second per node—yes, you read that right.

**Key Features**

1. **Performance-Centric**: QuestDB's architecture means minimal hardware is needed for maximum efficiency. You'll see it thrive on low-spec machines, yet it scales brilliantly with robust setups.

2. **SQL Compatibility**: As developers, it was crucial for QuestDB to ensure compatibility with SQL and PostgreSQL wire protocols. This makes it easy to integrate into existing workflows without a steep learning curve.

3. **Open Source & Community Love**: Being open source, QuestDB invites contributions and interaction from a growing user community. G2 reviews have shown high user satisfaction for its straightforward setup and performance.

4. **Use Cases Across Industries**: Its client base includes high-profile names like Airbus, OKX, and Mizuho, reflecting its application across diverse fields. Companies use QuestDB for real-time data processing, enabling rapid analysis and decision-making.

5. **Innovative Features**: With powerful SQL extensions for time series data, users can execute millisecond queries and benefit from built-in features like deduplication and out-of-order data handling.

**Getting Started**

Whether you're managing market data, processing telemetry from satellites, or analyzing energy consumption, QuestDB positions itself as a robust solution. New users can explore a live demo that showcases its speed and capabilities. You can visit [QuestDB's website](https://questdb.io) for more resources, from documentation to community forums.

**Conclusion**

In a world where data is king, QuestDB is carving out its niche by focusing specifically on time series data management. With a blend of innovation, performance, and an open approach, it's a compelling option for data-driven companies looking to unlock the full potential of their real-time data.
